text: Physoglenidae is a family of araneomorph spiders first described by Alexander Petrunkevitch in 1928 as a subfamily of Pholcidae. It was later moved to Synotaxidae until a study in 2016 showed that they formed a distinct clade. ==Genera== , the World Spider Catalog accepts the following genera: *Calcarsynotaxus Wunderlich, 1995 — Australia *Chileotaxus Platnick, 1990 — Chile *Mangua Forster, 1990 — New Zealand *Meringa Forster, 1990 — New Zealand *Microsynotaxus Wunderlich, 2008 — Australia *Nomaua Forster, 1990 — New Zealand *Pahora Forster, 1990 — New Zealand *Pahoroides Forster, 1990 — New Zealand *Paratupua Platnick, 1990 — Australia *Physoglenes Simon, 1904 — Chile *Runga Forster, 1990 — New Zealand *Tupua Platnick, 1990 — Australia *Zeatupua Fitzgerald & Sirvid, 2009 — New Zealand ==References== Category:Araneomorphae families
title: Physoglenidae
